New Records: The Dodgers matched an MLB postseason record with 33 consecutive scoreless innings, tying the record set by the Baltimore Orioles in the 1966 World Series.
The Dodgers set an NL postseason record with 29 consecutive scoreless innings.
Key Match Events: Jack Flaherty pitched seven scoreless innings, allowing just two hits and striking out six.
Max Muncy hit a two-RBI single in the first inning.
Shohei Ohtani hit an RBI single in the second inning.
Mookie Betts hit a three-RBI double in the eighth inning.
Daniel Hudson pitched a scoreless eighth inning despite allowing two baserunners.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Dave Roberts mentioned the possibility of using a bullpen game strategy for Game 2, depending on the usage in Game 1.
The Mets were concerned about how to handle Shohei Ohtani, especially in the later innings due to their limited left-handed relievers.
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers are now just three wins away from reaching their first World Series since 2020.
The Mets face a significant challenge if they cannot secure a win in California before heading back to Citi Field.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played under ideal weather conditions with 72 degrees and clear skies.
Manny Ramirez, a former Dodgers player, was present at the game.
The national anthem and a flyover were part of the pre-game ceremonies.
